intro: Taraxacum vanum, commonly known as the Vanuatu dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the island nation of Vanuatu in the South Pacific. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features a rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces a tall, hollow stem topped with a yellow composite flower head. Its flowers are typically visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to local biodiversity. Taraxacum vanum is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat.
